title: Fragmentary bilingual epitaph for Marylla
support: Two joining fragments preserving the upper left portion of the text (top left corner is intact); the right hand fragment is more poorly preserved with the surface more degraded. The rear of the stone is very rough and uneven.

layout.p: Remains of two lines of Latin letters across the stone, with traces of a third line in Greek below

handNote.lettering: Thinly incised letters with terminal points/serifs to the strokes. Greek letters are much smaller than Latin letters. The M tends lightly towards the cursive form, and some letters join at the foot; A in the Latin text has an upward sloping cross-bar; Greek text appears to have lunate epsilon.

date._: 1st century or beginning of 2nd century CE (Korhonen)

provenanceObserved._: Observed by Mommsen in the Collezione Biscari. Formerly in sala IX.89, now in magazzino superiore

facsimile.desc: Photo J. Prag courtesy Museo Civico di Catania

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
